alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; Buckeye, Avondale; Central Phoenix; Dripping Springs; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; Globe, Miami; Northwest Pinal County; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; San Carlos; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Gila County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek; Superior; Tonopah Desert; Tonto Basin; West Pinal County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 7:43PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 830 PM MST... At 742 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm winds moving south at 25 mph. Blowing dust also possible. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Apache Junction, Globe, Superior, East Mesa, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Miami, Gold Camp, San Tan Valley, Seville and South Mountain Park. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 156 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 173 and 265. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 149 and 172. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
